meanings.definition: Delay or hold back in terms of progress or development.
meanings.sent1: The heavy rain will retard the growth of the plants in the garden.
meanings.sent2: Please do not let your fear of failure retard your efforts to learn new things.
meanings.sent3: Trying to run with untied shoelaces will only retard your progress.
meanings.sent4: His constant interruptions during the meeting retarded the team's ability to reach a decision.
meanings.sent5: The lack of proper resources can retard the completion of the project.

meanings.definition: A person who is mentally handicapped.
meanings.sent1: The school provides special education services for the retard in our class.
meanings.sent2: It is important to treat every retard with kindness and respect.
meanings.sent3: The comedian made a tasteless joke about a retard, which was not funny at all.
meanings.sent4: She felt guilty for using the word 'retard' to describe her brother with special needs.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed the main character as a lovable retard who overcame many challenges.

meanings.definition: To slow down or impede the progress of something.
meanings.sent1: The construction on the road will retard traffic flow for the next few weeks.
meanings.sent2: Using outdated technology can retard the efficiency of a business.
meanings.sent3: His habit of procrastination tends to retard his academic performance.
meanings.sent4: The lack of communication between departments can retard the completion of projects.
meanings.sent5: The strong winds will retard the sailing race scheduled for tomorrow.
